routing-policy_schema.description: Routing policies are used to filter routes and control the receiving and advertising of routes. By changing the route attributes, such as reachability, you can change the path through which the traffic passes.

ext-community-soo-filters.description: List of extended community attribute SoO filters. Routes are filtered based on the SoO extended community attributes of routes.

ext-community-soo-filter.description: Configure an SoO extended community filter, which filters routes based on the SoO extended community attribute.

name.description: Name of an extended community SoO filter. The name is a string and cannot contain spaces.

filter-type.description: Type of an extended community SoO filter, which can be basic or advanced.

basic-nodes.description: List of basic extended community SoO filter nodes. You can use the SoO extended community ID as a matching condition.

basic-node.description: Configure a node for a basic SoO extended community filter, with the SoO extended community attribute specified as a matching rule.

items.description:
Configure a value for the SoO attribute in an SoO extended community filter. The value can be in any of the following formats:
(1) as-number:nn (as-number is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535, and nn is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295)
(2) IPv4-address:nn
(3) as-number.as-number:nn
(4) as-number:nn (as-number is an integer ranging from 65536 to 4294967295, and nn is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

advanced-nodes.description: List of advanced extended community SoO filter nodes. You can use a regular expression as a matching condition.

advanced-node.description: Configure a node in an advanced extended community SoO filter, with a regular expression specified as a matching rule.

regular.description: Regular expression that is used for matching.

community-filters.description: List of community attribute filters. Routes are filtered based on the community attributes of routes.

community-filter.description: Configure a community attribute filter, which filters routes based on community attributes. Different nodes of a community filter cannot be configured with the same filtering rules.

name.description: Name of a community filter, which can be a numeral or a string. The ID of a basic community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 1 to 99; the ID of an advanced community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 100 to 199. The name of a community attribute filter is a string of 1 to 51 characters. The string cannot contain only digits.

filter-type.description: Type of a community filter, which can be basic or advanced.

basic-nodes.description: List of basic community filter nodes. You can use the community ID or the attribute of a known community as a matching condition.

basic-node.description: Configure a node in a basic community filter, with a community number or well-known community attribute as a matching rule.

value.description: Community attribute value.

internet-strict-match.description: Enable/disable strict matching for routes with the internet community attribute.

advanced-nodes.description: List of advanced community filter nodes. You can use a regular expression as a matching condition.

advanced-node.description: Configure a node in an advanced community filter, with a regular expression specified as a matching rule.

regular.description: Regular expression that is used for matching.

ext-community-filters.description: List of extended community filters. You can use the route-target extended community as a matching condition.

ext-community-filter.description: Configure an extended community filter, with a VPN-Target extended community specified as a matching rule.

name.description: Name of an extended community filter, which can be a numeral or a string. The ID of a basic extended community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 1 to 199; the ID of an advanced extended community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 200 to 399. The name of an extended community attribute filter is a string of 1 to 51 characters. The string cannot contain only digits.

filter-type.description: Type of an extended community filter, which can be basic or advanced.

basic-nodes.description: List of extended community filter nodes.

basic-node.description: Configure a node for an extended community filter.

ext-community-members.description: List of nodes in an extended community filter.

ext-community-member.description: Configure a node for an extended community filter.

value.description:
Extended community attribute value. The format are as follows:
(1)as-number : nn ('as-number' ranges from 0 to 65535 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 4294967295).
(2)IPv4-address : nn ('IPv4-address' is an IPv4 address and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).
(3)as-number.as-number:nn ('as-number' ranges from 0 to 65535 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).
(4)as-number : nn ('as-number' ranges from 65536 to 4294967295 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).

advanced-nodes.description: List of advanced extended community filter nodes. You can use a regular expression as a matching condition.

advanced-node.description: Configure a node in an advanced extended community filter, with a regular expression specified as a matching rule.

regular.description: Regular expression that is used for matching.

ipv4-prefix-filter.description: Configure an IPv4 prefix list, which contains a group of route filtering rules. Different nodes of an IPv4 prefix filter cannot be configured with the same filtering rules.

name.description: Name of an IPv4 prefix filter.

permit-count.description: Number of routes that match the route-policy.

deny-count.description: Number of routes that do not match the route-policy.

nodes.description: List of IPv4 prefix filter nodes.

node.description: Configure a node in an IPv4 prefix list. You can specify a prefix range and a mask length range in the node to match the destination network segment addresses or next-hop addresses in routes. There must be at least one node in a filter, min-elements 1. An IPv4 address and its mask must strictly match.

match-network.description: Enable/disable matching of network segment routes with the IPv4 prefix being 0.0.0.0.

masklength-lower.description: If both the IP address and mask length match, this parameter is used to specify the range lower of IP prefixes.

masklength-upper.description: If both the IP address and mask length match, this parameter is used to specify the range upper of IP prefixes.

ipv6-prefix-filter.description: Configure an IPv6 prefix list, which contains a group of route filtering rules. Different nodes of an IPv6 prefix filter cannot be configured with the same filtering rules.

name.description: Name of an IPv6 prefix filter. The name is a string and cannot contain spaces.

permit-count.description: Number of routes that match the route-policy.

deny-count.description: Number of routes that do not match the route-policy.

nodes.description: List of IPv6 prefix filter nodes.

node.description: Configure a node in an IPv6 prefix list. You can specify a prefix range and a mask length range in the node to match the destination network segment addresses or next-hop addresses in routes. There must be at least one node in a filter, min-elements 1. An IPv6 address and its mask must strictly match.

match-network.description: Enable/disable matching of network segment routes with the IPv6 prefix being ::.

masklength-lower.description: If both the IP address and mask length match, this parameter is used to specify the range lower of IP prefixes.

masklength-upper.description: If both the IP address and mask length match, this parameter is used to specify the range upper of IP prefixes.

ext-community-segmented-nexthop-filters.description: List of segmented next-hop extended community filters, which are used to filter routes based on segmented-nh attributes.

ext-community-segmented-nexthop-filter.description: Configure a segmented next-hop extended community filter, which is used to filter routes based on the segmented-nh attribute.

name.description: Name of a segmented next-hop extended community filter.

filter-type.description: Type of a segmented next-hop extended community filter, which can be basic or advanced. Regular expressions can be used to configure matching rules for advanced extended community filters, but not for basic extended community filters.

basic-nodes.description: List of nodes in a basic segmented next-hop extended community filter, with segmented-nh attributes used as matching rules.

basic-node.description: Configure a node in a basic segmented next-hop extended community filter, with a segmented-nh attribute used as a matching rule.

sequence.description: Sequence number of a node in a basic segmented next-hop extended community filter.

match-mode.description: Matching mode of a node in a basic segmented next-hop extended community filter.

ext-community-segmented-nexthop-members.description: List of values of segmented-nh attributes.

ext-community-segmented-nexthop-member.description: Configure a value for a segmented next-hop extended community filter.

value.description:
Attribute value of a segmented next-hop extended community filter, which can be in any of the following formats:
(1) as-number:nn
(2) IPv4-address: nn
(3) as-number.as-number:nn
(4) as-number:nn.

advanced-nodes.description: List of nodes of an advanced segmented next-hop extended community filter. Regular expressions are used as matching rules.

advanced-node.description: Configure a node in an advanced segmented next-hop extended community filter, with a regular expression specified as a matching rule.

sequence.description: Sequence number of a node in an advanced segmented next-hop extended community filter.

match-mode.description: Matching mode of a node in an advanced segmented next-hop extended community filter.

regular.description: Regular expression used to match the extended community attribute.

as-path-filters.description: List of AS_Path filters. Routes are filtered based on the AS_Path attributes of routes.

as-path-filter.description: Configure an AS_Path filter, which filters routes based on their AS_Path attributes. Different nodes of an AS_Path filter cannot be configured with the same filtering rules.

name.description: Name of a AS_Path filter, which can be a numeral or a string. The ID of an as-path attribute filter is an integer ranging from 1 to 256. The name of a as-path attribute filter is a string of 1 to 51 characters. The string cannot contain only digits.

node.description: Configure a node in an AS_Path filter.

regular.description: Regular expression that is used for filtering. The AS number in regular expression of AS-path should be the same with 4-byte as-notation format of BGP, otherwise match will fail.

name.description: Community list name.

items.description: Configure a community attribute in a BGP community list. There must be at least one community in a list, min-elements 1.

rd-filters.description: List of RD filters. You can use the RD as a matching condition.

rd-filter.description: Configure a list of nodes in an RD filter. Different nodes of an RD filter cannot be configured with the same filtering rules.

name.description: Name of an RD filter.

node.description: Configure a node in an RD filter.

value.description: RD attribute value, which can be in the format of IPv4-address:nn (for example, x.x.x.x:200), the format of aa:nn (for example, 100:1), the format of IPv4-address:* (for example, x.x.x.x:*), or the format of aa:* (for example, 100:*). The example 'x.x.x.x:*' indicates that all the RDs starting with x.x.x.x are matched, and the example '100:*' indicates that all the RDs starting with 100 are matched.

name.description: Configure a VNI filter name.

value.description: Configure a VNI value.

name.description: Configure a MAC filter name.

value.description: Configure a MAC value in format: H-H-H.

eth-tag-filters.description: List of Ethernet tag ID filters.

eth-tag-filter.description: Configure an Ethernet tag ID filter.

name.description: Configure an Ethernet tag ID filter name.

eth-tag-member.description: Configure an Ethernet tag ID node.

value.description: Configure an Ethernet tag ID value.

name.description: Configure an IPv4 prefix list name.

prefix-members.description: List of IPv4 prefix address and mask.

prefix-member.description: Configure an IPv4 address and masklength.

name.description: Configure an IPv6 prefix list name.

prefix-members.description: List of IPv6 prefix address and mask.

prefix-member.description: Configure an IPv6 address and masklength.

large-community-filters.description: List of large community attribute filters. Routes are filtered based on the large community attributes of routes.

large-community-filter.description: Configure a Large-Community filter, which filters routes based on Large-Community attributes.

name.description: Name of a large community filter.

filter-type.description: Type of a large community attribute filter, which can be basic or advanced.

basic-nodes.description: List of basic large community filter nodes. You can use the large community attribute as a matching condition.

basic-node.description: Configure a list of nodes in a basic Large-Community filter, with Large-Community attributes specified as matching rules.

sequence.description: Node number of a basic large community attribute filter.

match-mode.description: Matching mode of a node in the basic large community attribute filter.

large-community-members.description: List of large community attribute values. A maximum of 16 values are supported.

large-community-member.description: Configure a value for the Large-Community attribute in a Large-Community filter.

value.description: Large community attribute value, which can be in the following formats: NN:NN:NN. ('NN' ranges from 0 to 4294967295).

advanced-nodes.description: List of advanced large community filter nodes. You can use a regular expression as a matching condition.

advanced-node.description: Configure a node in an advanced Large-Community filter, with a regular expression specified as a matching rule.

sequence.description: Node number of an advanced large community attribute filter.

match-mode.description: Matching mode of a node in the advanced large community attribute filter.

regular.description: Regular expression that is used for matching.

name.description: Large community list name.

value.description: Large community Value. There must be at least one community in a list, min-elements 1.

ext-community-priority-color-filters.description: List of extended community attribute priority-color filters. Routes are filtered based on the priority-color extended community attributes of routes.

ext-community-priority-color-filter.description: Configure an priority-color extended community filter, which filters routes based on the priority-color extended community attribute.

name.description: Name of an extended community priority-color filter. The name is a string and cannot contain spaces.

basic-nodes.description: List of basic extended community priority-color filter nodes. You can use the priority-color extended community ID as a matching condition.

basic-node.description: Configure a node for a basic priority-color extended community filter, with the priority-color extended community attribute specified as a matching rule.

items.description: Configure a value for the priority-color attribute in an priority-color extended community filter. The value can be in the format of priority<0-15>:site-id<1-4294967295>.

advanced-nodes.description: List of advanced extended community priority-color filter nodes. You can use a regular expression as a matching condition.

advanced-node.description: Configure a node in an advanced extended community priority-color filter, with a regular expression specified as a matching rule.

regular.description: Regular expression that is used for matching.

name.description: Policy name in the format of a string.

address-family-mismatch-deny.description: Enable/disable the function of denying when address family mismatch.

node.description: Configure a node in a route-policy to filter routes.

match-count.description: Match count of route policy node.

conditions.description: Configure a list of matching types for a node in a route-policy.

match-tag.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the route tag.

value.description: Route tag, which is used for route classification.

match-ext-community-soo.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the SoO extended community filter.

ext-community-soo-filter-ref.description: Index of an extended community SoO filter.

match-ext-community-filters.description: List of VPN-Target extended community filters.

match-ext-community-filter.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the VPN-Target extended community filter.

ext-community-filter-ref.description: Index of an extended community filter.

match-community-filter.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the community filter.

community-filter-ref.description: Name or index of a community attribute filter. It can be a numeral or a string. The ID of a basic community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 1 to 99; the ID of an advanced community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 100 to 199. The name of a community attribute filter is a string of 1 to 51 characters. The string cannot contain only digits.

whole-match.description: All the communities are matched. It is valid to only basic community attribute filters.
All the communities are matched. It is valid to only basic community attribute filters.

sort-match.description: Match all community attributes in sequence. It is valid to only Advanced community attribute filters.
Match all community attributes in sequence. It is valid to only Advanced community attribute filters.

match-as-path-filter.description: Configure a list of AS_Path filters as filtering rules.

filter-name.description: Name or index of a AS-Path filter, which can be a numeral or a string. The ID of a as-path attribute filter is an integer ranging from 1 to 256. The name of a as-path attribute filter is a string of 1 to 51 characters. The string cannot contain only digits.

match-protocols.description: List of protocol types that are used as filtering rules.

match-protocol.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the protocol type.

match-cost.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the route cost.

value.description: Value.
Route cost value.

lower.description: Lower limit of a route cost range.

upper.description: Upper limit of a route cost range.

match-preference.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the route priority.

value.description: Priority of the matched protocol.

match-ext-community-segmented-nexthop-fi.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the segmented-nh attribute.

ext-community-segmented-nexthop-filter-r.description: Name of a segmented next-hop extended community filter.

match-interfaces.description: List of outbound interfaces that are used for filtering rules.

match-interface.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the outbound interface.

match-route-types.description: List of route types that are used for filtering rules.

match-route-type.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the route type.

match-mpls-label.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the MPLS label.

mpls-label.description: Enabling mode that is specified during MPLS label matching.

match-rd-filter.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on an RD filter.

match-mac-filter.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on a MAC address list.

match-l3vni-filter.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on a Layer 3 VNI list.

match-type.description: Mode of matching an L3VNI filter.

match-l2vni-filter.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on a Layer 2 VNI list.

match-type.description: Mode of matching an L2VNI filter.

match-eth-tag-filter.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on an Ethernet tag list.

eth-tag-filter-ref.description: Match a specified Ethernet tag ID name.

match-large-community-filter.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on a Large-Community filter.

community-filter-ref.description: Name a large community attribute filter.

whole-match.description: All the communities are matched. It is valid to only basic community attribute filters.
All the communities are matched. It is valid to only basic community attribute filters.

match-as-path-length.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the AS_Path length.

value.description: Value.
AS path length, which is used to control length of AS path.

lower.description: Lower limit of AS path length range.

upper.description: Upper limit of a AS path length range.

match-prefix-mod.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the route prefix modulo operation result.

mod-value.description: Specifies a route prefix modulus value.

mod-result.description: Specifies the route prefix modulo operation result.

match-ipv4-destination.description: References IPv4 prefix filter or IPv4 destination addresses ACL rule.

match-ipv4-prefix.description: Configure a filtering rule to filter routes with destination IPv4 addresses matching an IPv4 prefix list.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv4 destination addresses are matched.

match-ipv6-prefix.description: Configure a filtering rule to filter routes with destination IPv6 addresses matching an IPv6 prefix list.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv6 destination addresses are matched.

match-ipv4-nexthop.description: Match IPv4 next hops. References IPv4 prefix filter or IPv4 destination addresses ACL rule.

match-nexthop-ipv4-prefix.description: Configure a filtering rule to filter routes with IPv4 next hops matching an IPv4 prefix list.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv4 next hops are matched.

match-ipv6-nexthop.description: Match IPv6 next hops. References IPv6 prefix filter or IPv6 destination addresses ACL rule.

match-nexthop-ipv6-prefix.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the next-hop IPv6 address.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv6 next hops are matched.

match-ipv4-route-source.description: Match IPv4 route sources. References IPv4 prefix filter or IPv4 destination addresses ACL rule.

match-route-source-ipv4-prefix.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the IPv4 addresses of the originators that send these routes.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv4 route sources are matched.

match-ipv6-route-source.description: Match IPv6 route sources. References IPv6 prefix filter or IPv6 destination addresses ACL rule.

match-route-source-ipv6-prefix.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the IPv6 addresses of the originators that send these routes.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv6 route sources are matched.

match-route-originator.description: Matches routes using the list of IP addresses of route senders.

match-originator-ipv4-prefix.description: Configure an NG MVPN route filtering rule that is based on the IP addresses of a multicast group.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv4 destination addresses are matched.

match-group-address.description: Match IPv4 group address. References IPv4 prefix filter or IPv4 destination addresses ACL rule.

match-group-address-ipv4-prefix.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the multicast group address.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv4 destination addresses are matched.

match-ext-community-priority-color.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on the priority-color extended community filter.

not-match-priority.description: Enable/disable the function of ignoring priority.

ext-community-priority-color-filter-ref.description: Index of an extended community priority-color filter.

actions.description: Configure the type of a filtering rule.

apply-local-preference.description: Configure a value for the local preference (Local-Pref) attribute in BGP routes.

operation.description: Mode of setting the local priority.

value.description: Local priority of a route.

apply-cost.description: Configure an MED value for BGP routes or cost value for routes of another protocol.

operation.description: Mode of setting the route cost.

value.description: Route cost, which is used to control route selection.

apply-community.description: Configure community attributes for BGP routes.

operation.description:
Set the application mode of the community attribute. The available options are as follows:
Append: Append the configured community attribute to the original community attribute of a route.
Replace: To replace the original community attribute of a route with the configured community attribute.
Delete: Delete all the original community attributes of a route.

set-community.description: Option to set communities using an inline list or reference to an existing defined set.

inline.description: Set the community values for the update inline with a list.

items.description:
Configure BGP community values. The value can be in any of the following formats:
(1) Integer
(2) aa:nn
(3) Well-known community attribute (internet, no-export-subconfed, no-advertise, or no-export).

inline-string.description: Set community values using character strings.

value.description: Community attributes. A maximum of 32 community attributes can be configured, which are separated by spaces. Each community attribute can be in any of the following formats: Integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295; x:y, in which x ranges from 0 to 65535, and y ranges from 0 to 65535; Well-known community attribute (internet, no-export-subconfed, no-advertise, or no-export).

reference.description: References a defined community set by name.

community-list-ref.description: The communities are specified by referencing a defined community list name.

apply-ext-community-soo.description: Configure Source of Origin (SoO) extended community attributes for BGP routes.

operation.description: Apply the configured SoO value to the original SoO value of a route.

items.description:
Configure a value for the SoO extended community attribute in routes. The value can be in any of the following formats:
(1) as-number:nn (as-number is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535, and nn is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295)
(2) IPv4-address:nn
(3) as-number.as-number:nn
(4) as-number:nn (as-number is an integer ranging from 65536 to 4294967295, and nn is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

apply-mpls-label.description: Configure the allocation of MPLS labels to public network routes.

mpls-label.description: Enabling mode that is specified during MPLS label settings.

apply-preferred.description: Configure a preferred value for BGP routes.

value.description: Preferred value of a BGP route.

apply-aigp.description: Configure a value for the accumulated IGP (AIGP) metric attribute in BGP routes.

operation.description: Mode of setting route accumulated IGP metric.

value.description: Specify metric value.

apply-tag.description: Configure a tag for filtered routes.

value.description: Tag value of a route.

apply-ipv4-nexthop.description: Configure a next-hop IPv4 address for filtered routes.

apply-ipv6-nexthop.description: Configure a next-hop IPv6 address for filtered routes.

apply-cost-type.description: Configure a cost type for filtered routes.

value.description: Route cost type.

apply-origin.description: Configure a value for the Origin attribute in BGP routes.

origin-type.description:
Source of BGP routing information. The available options are as follows:egp: indicates that BGP routing information comes from the EGP route. The as-number parameter is required to specify the AS number of the EGP route.
igp: indicates that BGP routing information comes from the IGP route.
incomplete: The source of BGP routing information is unknown.

value.description: Set the AS_Path value for external routes, which can be an integer or in dotted decimal notation.

apply-preference.description: Configure a priority for filtered routes.

value.description: Protocol priority.

apply-route-type.description: Configure the level of routes imported to IS-IS.

value.description: Route type.

apply-traffic.description: Configure a BGP traffic index for statistics collection.

value.description: BGP traffic index.

apply-priority.description: Configure a priority for imported routes.

value.description: Import route priority.

apply-ipv4-gateway.description: Configure a gateway IP address for routes.

gateway-type.description: Set the mode for configuring the GWIP for routes.

address.description: Set a specified IP address as the GWIP.

apply-ipv6-gateway.description: Configure a gateway IPv6 address for routes.

gateway-type.description: Set the mode for configuring the GWIP for IPv6 routes.

address.description: Set a specified IPv6 address as the GWIP.

apply-ext-community.description: Configure VPN-Target extended community attributes for BGP routes.

operation.description: Apply the configured rt value to the original rt value of a route.

ext-community-members.description: List of extend community attribute value.

ext-community-member.description: Configure VPN-Target extended community attributes for BGP routes.

value.description:
Extended community attribute value. The format are as follows:
(1)as-number : nn ('as-number' ranges from 0 to 65535 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 4294967295).
(2)IPv4-address : nn ('IPv4-address' is an IPv4 address and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).
(3)as-number.as-number:nn ('as-number' ranges from 0 to 65535 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).

apply-community-filter-delete.description: Configure the deletion of BGP community attributes based on a community filter.

name.description: Name or index of a community attribute filter. It can be a numeral or a string. The ID of a basic community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 1 to 99; the ID of an advanced community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 100 to 199. The name of a community attribute filter is a string of 1 to 51 characters. The string cannot contain only digits.

apply-dampening.description: Configure dampening parameters for EBGP routes.

reuse-value.description: Threshold for the route to be unsuppressed. When the penalty value falls below the threshold, the route is reused.

suppress-value.description: Threshold for the route to be suppressed. When the penalty value of a route exceeds the suppression threshold, the route is suppressed.

ceiling-value.description: Penalty ceiling of the specified route.

local-id-ip-precedence.description: Set QoS local ID or IP precedence.

name.description: Name of traffic behavior.

apply-as-path.description: Configure the AS_Path attribute in BGP routes.

operation.description:
Additive: apply the configured AS value to the original AS value of a route.
Replace: replace the original AS value of a route with the configured AS value.
Delete: delete all the original AS value of a route.
Delete-special: delete the specified AS value of a route.

value.description: The AS number in an AS_Path can be in asplain format ranging from 1 to 4294967295 or in asdot format, X.Y for example, in which X ranges from 1 to 65535, and Y ranges from 0 to 65535.

apply-ext-community-redirect-ip.description: Configure the application of an IP address-based redirection extended community attribute to routes matching a route-policy.

value.description: Extended community attribute value, which can be in the format of IPv4-address : nn. ('IPv4-address' is an IPv4 address and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 1).

apply-ext-community-redirect-vpn.description: Configure the application of a VPN target-based redirection extended community attribute to routes matching a route-policy.

value.description:
Extended community attribute value. The format are as follows:
(1)as-number : nn ('as-number' ranges from 0 to 65535 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 4294967295).
(2)IPv4-address : nn ('IPv4-address' is an IPv4 address and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).
(3)as-number.as-number:nn ('as-number' ranges from 0 to 65535 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).
(4)as-number : nn ('as-number' ranges from 65536 to 4294967295 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).

apply-ext-community-color.description: Configure a value for the color extended community attribute in BGP routes.

value.description: Extcommunity attribute value, in the format of FLAG<0-0>:nn<1-4294967295>.

apply-entropy-label-none.description: Configure the discarding of the entropy label in BGP routes.

entropy-label-none.description: Enable/disable the function of discarding entropy labels of BGP routes.

apply-peer-id.description: Configure an ID for a BGP peer group.

value.description: Set peer group ID.

apply-large-community.description: Configure values for the Large-Community attribute in BGP routes.

operation.description:
Set the application mode of the large community attribute. The available options are as follows:
(1)add: Append the configured large community attribute to the original large community attribute of a route.
(2)replace: To replace the original large community attribute of a route with the configured large community attribute.
(3)delete: Delete all the original large community attributes of a route.
(4)delete-special: Delete the specified large community attribute of a route.

large-community-members.description: List of large community attribute value.

large-community-member.description: Configure a value for the Large-Community attribute in a Large-Community filter.

value.description: Large Community attribute value, in the format of NN:NN:NN ('NN' range from 0 to 4294967295).

apply-ext-community-priority-color.description: Configure the application of an priority-color extended community attribute to routes matching a route-policy.

operation.description: Apply the configured priority-color value to the original priority-color value of a route.

items.description: Configure a priority-color extended community filter, which can be in the format of priority<0-15>:site-id<1-4294967295>.

apply-vn-id.description: Configure a virtual network ID for filtered routes.

value.description: Virtual network ID value of a route.

next-node-choice.description: Configure further route matching against a specified node after the routes match the current node. By default, if a route matches the current node, it matches the route-policy and is no longer matched against the other nodes.

is-goto-next-node.description: Enable/disable further route matching against a specified node after the routes match the current node.

tunnel-selector.description: Configure a tunnel selector, which is mainly used in BGP Option B and Option C scenarios. A tunnel policy is selected based on the matching rules set in the tunnel selector.

name.description: Name of a tunnel selector. The name is a string case-sensitive characters without spaces.

node.description: Configure a tunnel selector. You can specify rules in the tunnel selector to recurse routes to a desired tunnel.

conditions.description: Configure a list of matching types.

match-rd-filter.description: Configure a filtering rule based on RD filters.

match-community-filters.description: List of community filters used to match routes.

match-community-filter.description: Configure a matching rule that is based on a community filter.

community-filter-ref.description: Name or index of a community attribute filter. It can be a numeral or a string. The ID of a basic community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 1 to 99; the ID of an advanced community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 100 to 199. The name of a community attribute filter is a string of 1 to 51 characters. The string cannot contain only digits.

whole-match.description: Whole match.
All the communities are matched. It is valid to only basic community attribute filters.

sort-match.description: Sort match.
Match all community attributes in sequence. It is valid to only Advanced community attribute filters.

match-ipv4-prefix.description: Configure a matching rule that is based on an IP prefix list.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv4 destination addresses are matched.

match-ipv4-nexthop.description: Match IPv4 next hops. References IPv4 prefix filter or IPv4 destination addresses ACL rule.

match-nexthop-ipv4-prefix.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on an IPv4 prefix list or ACL to match next hops of IPv4 routes.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv4 next hops are matched.

match-ipv6-nexthop.description: Match IPv6 next hops. The configurations of matching IPv6 next hops based on ACL rules are mutually exclusive with the configurations of matching IPv6 next hops by the prefix filter.

match-nexthop-ipv6-prefix.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on an IPv6 prefix list to match next hops of IPv6 routes.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv6 next hops are matched.

actions.description: Configure a list of setting types in a tunnel selector.

apply-tunnel-policy.description: Configure the application of a tunnel policy to a tunnel selector. Tunnels are selected for services based on specified tunnel policies.

tunnel-policy-ref.description: Name of a tunnel policy. The name is a string case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ext-community-soo-filters_schema.description: List of extended community attribute SoO filters. Routes are filtered based on the SoO extended community attributes of routes.

ext-community-soo-filter.description: Configure an SoO extended community filter, which filters routes based on the SoO extended community attribute.

items.description:
Configure a value for the SoO attribute in an SoO extended community filter. The value can be in any of the following formats:
(1) as-number:nn (as-number is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535, and nn is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295)
(2) IPv4-address:nn
(3) as-number.as-number:nn
(4) as-number:nn (as-number is an integer ranging from 65536 to 4294967295, and nn is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

ipv4-prefix-filter.description: Configure an IPv4 prefix list, which contains a group of route filtering rules. Different nodes of an IPv4 prefix filter cannot be configured with the same filtering rules.

name.description: Name of an IPv4 prefix filter.

permit-count.description: Number of routes that match the route-policy.

deny-count.description: Number of routes that do not match the route-policy.

nodes.description: List of IPv4 prefix filter nodes.

node.description: Configure a node in an IPv4 prefix list. You can specify a prefix range and a mask length range in the node to match the destination network segment addresses or next-hop addresses in routes. There must be at least one node in a filter, min-elements 1. An IPv4 address and its mask must strictly match.

match-network.description: Enable/disable matching of network segment routes with the IPv4 prefix being 0.0.0.0.

masklength-lower.description: If both the IP address and mask length match, this parameter is used to specify the range lower of IP prefixes.

masklength-upper.description: If both the IP address and mask length match, this parameter is used to specify the range upper of IP prefixes.

value.description: RD attribute value, which can be in the format of IPv4-address:nn (for example, x.x.x.x:200), the format of aa:nn (for example, 100:1), the format of IPv4-address:* (for example, x.x.x.x:*), or the format of aa:* (for example, 100:*). The example 'x.x.x.x:*' indicates that all the RDs starting with x.x.x.x are matched, and the example '100:*' indicates that all the RDs starting with 100 are matched.

apply-community.description: Configure community attributes for BGP routes.

operation.description:
Set the application mode of the community attribute. The available options are as follows:
Append: Append the configured community attribute to the original community attribute of a route.
Replace: To replace the original community attribute of a route with the configured community attribute.
Delete: Delete all the original community attributes of a route.

set-community.description: Option to set communities using an inline list or reference to an existing defined set.

inline.description: Set the community values for the update inline with a list.

items.description:
Configure BGP community values. The value can be in any of the following formats:
(1) Integer
(2) aa:nn
(3) Well-known community attribute (internet, no-export-subconfed, no-advertise, or no-export).

inline-string.description: Set community values using character strings.

value.description: Community attributes. A maximum of 32 community attributes can be configured, which are separated by spaces. Each community attribute can be in any of the following formats: Integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295; x:y, in which x ranges from 0 to 65535, and y ranges from 0 to 65535; Well-known community attribute (internet, no-export-subconfed, no-advertise, or no-export).

reference.description: References a defined community set by name.

community-list-ref.description: The communities are specified by referencing a defined community list name.

operation.description: Apply the configured SoO value to the original SoO value of a route.

items.description:
Configure a value for the SoO extended community attribute in routes. The value can be in any of the following formats:
(1) as-number:nn (as-number is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535, and nn is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295)
(2) IPv4-address:nn
(3) as-number.as-number:nn
(4) as-number:nn (as-number is an integer ranging from 65536 to 4294967295, and nn is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

apply-community.description: Configure community attributes for BGP routes.

operation.description:
Set the application mode of the community attribute. The available options are as follows:
Append: Append the configured community attribute to the original community attribute of a route.
Replace: To replace the original community attribute of a route with the configured community attribute.
Delete: Delete all the original community attributes of a route.

set-community.description: Option to set communities using an inline list or reference to an existing defined set.

inline.description: Set the community values for the update inline with a list.

items.description:
Configure BGP community values. The value can be in any of the following formats:
(1) Integer
(2) aa:nn
(3) Well-known community attribute (internet, no-export-subconfed, no-advertise, or no-export).

inline-string.description: Set community values using character strings.

value.description: Community attributes. A maximum of 32 community attributes can be configured, which are separated by spaces. Each community attribute can be in any of the following formats: Integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295; x:y, in which x ranges from 0 to 65535, and y ranges from 0 to 65535; Well-known community attribute (internet, no-export-subconfed, no-advertise, or no-export).

reference.description: References a defined community set by name.

community-list-ref.description: The communities are specified by referencing a defined community list name.

apply-ext-community-soo.description: Configure Source of Origin (SoO) extended community attributes for BGP routes.

operation.description: Apply the configured SoO value to the original SoO value of a route.

items.description:
Configure a value for the SoO extended community attribute in routes. The value can be in any of the following formats:
(1) as-number:nn (as-number is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535, and nn is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295)
(2) IPv4-address:nn
(3) as-number.as-number:nn
(4) as-number:nn (as-number is an integer ranging from 65536 to 4294967295, and nn is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

Source of BGP routing information. The available options are as follows:egp: indicates that BGP routing information comes from the EGP route. The as-number parameter is required to specify the AS number of the EGP route.
igp: indicates that BGP routing information comes from the IGP route.
incomplete: The source of BGP routing information is unknown.

ext-community-member.description: Configure VPN-Target extended community attributes for BGP routes.

value.description:
Extended community attribute value. The format are as follows:
(1)as-number : nn ('as-number' ranges from 0 to 65535 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 4294967295).
(2)IPv4-address : nn ('IPv4-address' is an IPv4 address and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).
(3)as-number.as-number:nn ('as-number' ranges from 0 to 65535 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).

apply-community-filter-delete.description: Configure the deletion of BGP community attributes based on a community filter.

name.description: Name or index of a community attribute filter. It can be a numeral or a string. The ID of a basic community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 1 to 99; the ID of an advanced community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 100 to 199. The name of a community attribute filter is a string of 1 to 51 characters. The string cannot contain only digits.

apply-dampening.description: Configure dampening parameters for EBGP routes.

reuse-value.description: Threshold for the route to be unsuppressed. When the penalty value falls below the threshold, the route is reused.

suppress-value.description: Threshold for the route to be suppressed. When the penalty value of a route exceeds the suppression threshold, the route is suppressed.

ceiling-value.description: Penalty ceiling of the specified route.

local-id-ip-precedence.description: Set QoS local ID or IP precedence.

name.description: Name of traffic behavior.

apply-as-path.description: Configure the AS_Path attribute in BGP routes.

operation.description:
Additive: apply the configured AS value to the original AS value of a route.
Replace: replace the original AS value of a route with the configured AS value.
Delete: delete all the original AS value of a route.
Delete-special: delete the specified AS value of a route.

value.description: The AS number in an AS_Path can be in asplain format ranging from 1 to 4294967295 or in asdot format, X.Y for example, in which X ranges from 1 to 65535, and Y ranges from 0 to 65535.

apply-ext-community-redirect-ip.description: Configure the application of an IP address-based redirection extended community attribute to routes matching a route-policy.

apply-ext-community-redirect-vpn.description: Configure the application of a VPN target-based redirection extended community attribute to routes matching a route-policy.

value.description:
Extended community attribute value. The format are as follows:
(1)as-number : nn ('as-number' ranges from 0 to 65535 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 4294967295).
(2)IPv4-address : nn ('IPv4-address' is an IPv4 address and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).
(3)as-number.as-number:nn ('as-number' ranges from 0 to 65535 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).
(4)as-number : nn ('as-number' ranges from 65536 to 4294967295 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).

apply-ext-community-color.description: Configure a value for the color extended community attribute in BGP routes.

value.description: Extcommunity attribute value, in the format of FLAG<0-0>:nn<1-4294967295>.

entropy-label-none.description: Enable/disable the function of discarding entropy labels of BGP routes.

apply-peer-id.description: Configure an ID for a BGP peer group.

value.description: Set peer group ID.

apply-large-community.description: Configure values for the Large-Community attribute in BGP routes.

operation.description:
Set the application mode of the large community attribute. The available options are as follows:
(1)add: Append the configured large community attribute to the original large community attribute of a route.
(2)replace: To replace the original large community attribute of a route with the configured large community attribute.
(3)delete: Delete all the original large community attributes of a route.
(4)delete-special: Delete the specified large community attribute of a route.

The name of a community attribute filter is a string of 1 to 51 characters. The string cannot contain only digits.

apply-dampening_schema.description: Configure dampening parameters for EBGP routes.

reuse-value.description: Threshold for the route to be unsuppressed. When the penalty value falls below the threshold, the route is reused.

suppress-value.description: Threshold for the route to be suppressed. When the penalty value of a route exceeds the suppression threshold, the route is suppressed.

ceiling-value.description: Penalty ceiling of the specified route.

local-id-ip-precedence.description: Set QoS local ID or IP precedence.

name.description: Name of traffic behavior.

apply-as-path_schema.description: Configure the AS_Path attribute in BGP routes.

operation.description:
Additive: apply the configured AS value to the original AS value of a route.
Replace: replace the original AS value of a route with the configured AS value.
Delete: delete all the original AS value of a route.
Delete-special: delete the specified AS value of a route.

value.description: The AS number in an AS_Path can be in asplain format ranging from 1 to 4294967295 or in asdot format, X.Y for example, in which X ranges from 1 to 65535, and Y ranges from 0 to 65535.

apply-ext-community-redirect-ip_schema.description: Configure the application of an IP address-based redirection extended community attribute to routes matching a route-policy.

value.description: Extended community attribute value, which can be in the format of IPv4-address : nn. ('IPv4-address' is an IPv4 address and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 1).

apply-ext-community-redirect-vpn_schema.description: Configure the application of a VPN target-based redirection extended community attribute to routes matching a route-policy.

value.description:
Extended community attribute value. The format are as follows:
(1)as-number : nn ('as-number' ranges from 0 to 65535 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 4294967295).
(2)IPv4-address : nn ('IPv4-address' is an IPv4 address and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).
(3)as-number.as-number:nn ('as-number' ranges from 0 to 65535 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).
(4)as-number : nn ('as-number' ranges from 65536 to 4294967295 and 'nn' ranges from 0 to 65535).

apply-ext-community-color_schema.description: Configure a value for the color extended community attribute in BGP routes.

value.description: Extcommunity attribute value, in the format of FLAG<0-0>:nn<1-4294967295>.

apply-entropy-label-none_schema.description: Configure the discarding of the entropy label in BGP routes.

entropy-label-none.description: Enable/disable the function of discarding entropy labels of BGP routes.

apply-peer-id_schema.description: Configure an ID for a BGP peer group.

value.description: Set peer group ID.

apply-large-community_schema.description: Configure values for the Large-Community attribute in BGP routes.

operation.description:
Set the application mode of the large community attribute. The available options are as follows:
(1)add: Append the configured large community attribute to the original large community attribute of a route.
(2)replace: To replace the original large community attribute of a route with the configured large community attribute.
(3)delete: Delete all the original large community attributes of a route.
(4)delete-special: Delete the specified large community attribute of a route.

large-community-members.description: List of large community attribute value.

large-community-member.description: Configure a value for the Large-Community attribute in a Large-Community filter.

value.description: Large Community attribute value, in the format of NN:NN:NN ('NN' range from 0 to 4294967295).

apply-ext-community-priority-color_schem.description: Configure the application of an priority-color extended community attribute to routes matching a route-policy.

operation.description: Apply the configured priority-color value to the original priority-color value of a route.

items.description: Configure a priority-color extended community filter, which can be in the format of priority<0-15>:site-id<1-4294967295>.

apply-vn-id_schema.description: Configure a virtual network ID for filtered routes.

value.description: Virtual network ID value of a route.

next-node-choice_schema.description: Configure further route matching against a specified node after the routes match the current node. By default, if a route matches the current node, it matches the route-policy and is no longer matched against the other nodes.

is-goto-next-node.description: Enable/disable further route matching against a specified node after the routes match the current node.

tunnel-selector.description: Configure a tunnel selector, which is mainly used in BGP Option B and Option C scenarios. A tunnel policy is selected based on the matching rules set in the tunnel selector.

name.description: Name of a tunnel selector. The name is a string case-sensitive characters without spaces.

node.description: Configure a tunnel selector. You can specify rules in the tunnel selector to recurse routes to a desired tunnel.

conditions.description: Configure a list of matching types.

match-rd-filter.description: Configure a filtering rule based on RD filters.

match-community-filters.description: List of community filters used to match routes.

match-community-filter.description: Configure a matching rule that is based on a community filter.

community-filter-ref.description: Name or index of a community attribute filter. It can be a numeral or a string. The ID of a basic community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 1 to 99; the ID of an advanced community attribute filter is an integer ranging from 100 to 199. The name of a community attribute filter is a string of 1 to 51 characters. The string cannot contain only digits.

whole-match.description: Whole match.
All the communities are matched. It is valid to only basic community attribute filters.

sort-match.description: Sort match.
Match all community attributes in sequence. It is valid to only Advanced community attribute filters.

match-ipv4-prefix.description: Configure a matching rule that is based on an IP prefix list.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv4 destination addresses are matched.

match-ipv4-nexthop.description: Match IPv4 next hops. References IPv4 prefix filter or IPv4 destination addresses ACL rule.

match-nexthop-ipv4-prefix.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on an IPv4 prefix list or ACL to match next hops of IPv4 routes.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv4 next hops are matched.

match-ipv6-nexthop.description: Match IPv6 next hops. The configurations of matching IPv6 next hops based on ACL rules are mutually exclusive with the configurations of matching IPv6 next hops by the prefix filter.

match-nexthop-ipv6-prefix.description: Configure a filtering rule that is based on an IPv6 prefix list to match next hops of IPv6 routes.

prefix-filter-ref.description: Name of the specified prefix filter when IPv6 next hops are matched.

actions.description: Configure a list of setting types in a tunnel selector.

apply-tunnel-policy.description: Configure the application of a tunnel policy to a tunnel selector. Tunnels are selected for services based on specified tunnel policies.

tunnel-policy-ref.description: Name of a tunnel policy. The name is a string case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

tunnel-policy-ref.description: Name of a tunnel policy. The name is a string case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
